chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
p: X -> Prop
Y: Type
q: Y -> Prop

Goal:
p ⪯ q -> decidable q -> decidable p

Premises:
decidable = fun (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) => exists f : X -> bool, decider f P : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments decidable {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
dec_conj : forall (X : Type) (p q : X -> Prop), decidable p -> decidable q -> decidable (fun x : X => p x /\ q x)
dec_disj : forall (X : Type) (p q : X -> Prop), decidable p -> decidable q -> decidable (fun x : X => p x \/ q x)
VectorDef.nth_order : VectorDef.t ?A ?n -> forall p0 : nat, p0 < ?n -> ?A where ?A : [X : Type p : X -> Prop Y : Type q : Y -> Prop |- Type] ?n : [X : Type p : X -> Prop Y : Type q : Y -> Prop |- nat]
Proper_decidable = fun (X : Type) (p q : X -> Prop) (H2 : Morphisms.pointwise_relation X iff p q) => conj (fun H0 : decidable p => match H0 with | ex_intro _ f H => ex_intro (fun f0 : X -> bool => decider f0 q) f ((fun lemma : Morphisms.pointwise_relation X iff p q => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Proper_decides tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl (Morphisms.pointwise_relation X eq)) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl (Morphisms.pointwise_relation X iff)) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation))) (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive f) q p (RelationClasses.symmetry lemma)) H2 H) end) (fun H0 : decidable q => match H0 with | ex_intro _ f H => ex...
Fin.caseS' : forall (p0 : Fin.t (S ?n)) (P : Fin.t (S ?n) -> Type), P Fin.F1 -> (forall p1 : Fin.t ?n, P (Fin.FS p1)) -> P p0 where ?n : [X : Type p : X -> Prop Y : Type q : Y -> Prop |- nat]
dec_compl : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), decidable p -> decidable (fun x : X => ~ p x)
SemiDecidabilityFacts.decidable_complement_semi_decidable = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (H : decidable p) => SemiDecidabilityFacts.decidable_semi_decidable (dec_compl X p H) : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), decidable p -> semi_decidable (complement p) Arguments SemiDecidabilityFacts.decidable_complement_semi_decidable {X}%type_scope {p}%function_scope
reduces_transitive : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (Q : Y -> Prop) (Z : Type) (R : Z -> Prop), P ⪯ Q -> Q ⪯ R -> P ⪯ R
dec_count_enum' : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), decidable p -> enumerable__T X -> enumerable (fun x : X => ~ p x)
dec_count_enum = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (H : decidable p) => let H0 : semi_decidable p := SemiDecidabilityFacts.decidable_semi_decidable H in fun H1 : enumerable__T X => semi_decidable_enumerable H1 H0 : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), decidable p -> enumerable__T X -> enumerable p Arguments dec_count_enum {X}%type_scope {p}%function_scope
VectorDef.caseS : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (S n) -> Type, (forall (h : ?A) (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t ?A n), P n (VectorDef.cons ?A h n t)) -> forall (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A (S n)), P n v where ?A : [X : Type p : X -> Prop Y : Type q : Y -> Prop |- Type]
BinNat.N.lcm_unique : forall n m p : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le BinNums.N0 p -> BinNat.N.divide n p -> BinNat.N.divide m p -> (forall q : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.divide n q -> BinNat.N.divide m q -> BinNat.N.divide p q) -> BinNat.N.lcm n m = p
BinNat.N.divide = fun p q : BinNums.N => exists r : BinNums.N, q = BinNat.N.mul r p : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.divide (_ _)%N_scope
reduces = fun (X Y : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Q : Y -> Prop) => exists f : X -> Y, reduction f P Q : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Prop) -> (Y -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments reduces {X Y}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
reduction = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (P : X -> Prop) (Q : Y -> Prop) => forall x : X, P x < -> Q (f x) : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> (X -> Prop) -> (Y -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments reduction {X Y}%type_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
reduces_dependent : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (Q : Y -> Prop), P ⪯ Q < -> inhabited (forall x : X, {y : Y | P x <-> Q y})
discrete = fun X : Type => decidable (fun '(x, y) => x = y) : Type -> Prop Arguments discrete _%type_scope
decidable_iff : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), decidable p < -> inhabited (forall x : X, dec (p x))
BinNat.N.add_lt_mono : forall n m p q : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.lt n m -> BinNat.N.lt p q -> BinNat.N.lt (BinNat.N.add n p) (BinNat.N.add m q)
BinNatDef.N.pow = fun n p : BinNums.N => match p with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH | BinNums.Npos p0 => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.pow q p0) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.pow (_ _)%N_scope
reduces_reflexive : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), P ⪯ P
BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub = fix pos_sub (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct y} : BinNums.Z := match x with | BinNums.xI p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinIntDef.Z.double (pos_sub p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinIntDef.Z.succ_double (pos_sub p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO p) end | BinNums.xO p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinIntDef.Z.pred_double (pos_sub p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinIntDef.Z.double (pos_sub p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.pred_double p) end | BinNums.xH => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.Zneg (BinNums.xO q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos...
SemiDecidabilityFacts.decidable_semi_decidable = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (H0 : decidable p) => match H0 with | ex_intro _ f H => ex_intro (fun f0 : X -> nat -> bool => semi_decider f0 p) (fun (x : X) (_ : nat) => f x) (fun x : X => (fun lemma : p x <-> f x = true => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (p x) (f x = true) lemma (exists _ : nat, f x = true) (exists _ : nat, f x = true) (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (exists _ : nat, f x = true))) (H x) (conj (fun H1 : f x = true => let H2 := 0 in (fun H3 : nat => ex_intro (fun _ : nat => f x = true) H3 H1) H2) (fun H1 :...
BinPosDef.Pos.add = with add (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct x} : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (add_carry p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ p) end | BinNums.xO p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xO (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xI p end | BinNums.xH => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI q | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO BinNum...
semi_decidable = fun (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) => exists f : X -> nat -> bool, semi_decider f P : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments semi_decidable {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
complement = fun (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (x : X) => ~ P x : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> X -> Prop Arguments complement {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
decider = fun (X : Type) (f : X -> bool) (P : X -> Prop) => forall x : X, reflects (f x) (P x) : forall X : Type, (X -> bool) -> (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments decider {X}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
semi_decider = fun (X : Type) (f : X -> nat -> bool) (P : X -> Prop) => forall x : X, P x < -> (exists n : nat, f x n = true) : forall X : Type, (X -> nat -> bool) -> (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments semi_decider {X}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
BinIntDef.Z.div = fun a b : BinNums.Z => let (q, _) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in q : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.div (_ _)%Z_scope
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => m | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => n | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.add p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
